description:
OWL-Time is an OWL-2 DL ontology of temporal concepts, for describing the temporal properties of resources in the world or described in Web pages.  The ontology provides a vocabulary for expressing facts about topological (ordering) relations among instants and intervals, together with information about durations, and about temporal position including date-time information.  Time positions and durations may be expressed using either the conventional (Gregorian) calendar and clock, or using another temporal reference system such as Unix-time, geologic time, or different calendars.

Version: 1.0.0

 - [SPARQL endpoint](https://triplydb.com/w3c/time/sparql/time)

DateTimeDescription.label: Date-Time description
DateTimeDescription.description: Description of date and time structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system. The temporal reference system is fixed to Gregorian Calendar, and the range of year, month, day properties restricted to corresponding XML Schema types xsd:gYear, xsd:gMonth and xsd:gDay, respectively.

DateTimeInterval.label: Date-time interval
DateTimeInterval.description: DateTimeInterval is a subclass of ProperInterval, defined using the multi-element DateTimeDescription.

Duration.label: Time duration
Duration.description: Duration of a temporal extent expressed as a number scaled by a temporal unit

DurationDescription.label: Duration description
DurationDescription.description: Description of temporal extent structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system. The temporal reference system is fixed to Gregorian Calendar, and the range of each of the numeric properties is restricted to xsd:decimal

GeneralDateTimeDescription.label: Generalized date-time description
GeneralDateTimeDescription.description: Description of date and time structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system

GeneralDurationDescription.label: Generalized duration description
GeneralDurationDescription.description: Description of temporal extent structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system.

Instant.label: Time instant
Instant.description: A temporal entity with zero extent or duration

Interval.label: Time interval
Interval.description: A temporal entity with an extent or duration

ProperInterval.label: Proper interval
ProperInterval.description: A temporal entity with non-zero extent or duration, i.e. for which the value of the beginning and end are different

TRS.label: Temporal Reference System
TRS.description: A temporal reference system, such as a temporal coordinate system (with an origin, direction, and scale), a calendar-clock combination, or a (possibly hierarchical) ordinal system. This is a stub class, representing the set of all temporal reference systems.

TemporalDuration.label: Temporal duration
TemporalDuration.description: Time extent; duration of a time interval separate from its particular start position

TemporalUnit.label: Temporal unit
TemporalUnit.description: A standard duration, which provides a scale factor for a time extent, or the granularity or precision for a time position.

TimePosition.label: Time position
TimePosition.description: A temporal position described using either a (nominal) value from an ordinal reference system, or a (numeric) value in a temporal coordinate system.

TimeZone.label: Time Zone
TimeZone.description: A Time Zone specifies the amount by which the local time is offset from UTC. 	A time zone is usually denoted geographically (e.g. Australian Eastern Daylight Time), with a constant value in a given region. The region where it applies and the offset from UTC are specified by a locally recognised governing authority.

after.label: after
after.description: Gives directionality to time. If a temporal entity T1 is after another temporal entity T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2.

before.label: before
before.description: Gives directionality to time. If a temporal entity T1 is before another temporal entity T2, then the end of T1 is before the beginning of T2. Thus, "before" can be considered to be basic to instants and derived for intervals.

day.label: day
day.description: Day position in a calendar-clock system.The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar day from any calendar.

dayOfWeek.label: day of week
dayOfWeek.description: The day of week, whose value is a member of the class time:DayOfWeek

dayOfYear.label: day of year
dayOfYear.description: The number of the day within the year

days.label: days duration
days.description: length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in days

generalDay.label: Generalized day
generalDay.description: Day of month - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gDay, except that values up to 99 are permitted, in order to support calendars with more than 31 days in a month. Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.

generalMonth.label: Generalized month
generalMonth.description: Month of year - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gMonth, except that values up to 20 are permitted, in order to support calendars with more than 12 months in the year. Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.

generalYear.label: Generalized year
generalYear.description: Year number - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gYear, but not restricted to values from the Gregorian calendar. Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.

hasDateTimeDescription.label: has Date-Time description
hasDateTimeDescription.description: Value of DateTimeInterval expressed as a structured value. The beginning and end of the interval coincide with the limits of the shortest element in the description.

hasDuration.label: has duration
hasDuration.description: Duration of a temporal entity, event or activity, or thing, expressed as a scaled value

hasDurationDescription.label: has duration description
hasDurationDescription.description: Duration of a temporal entity, expressed using a structured description

hasTRS.label: Temporal reference system used
hasTRS.description: The temporal reference system used by a temporal position or extent description.

hasTime.label: has time
hasTime.description: Supports the association of a temporal entity (instant or interval) to any thing

hasXSDDuration.label: has XSD duration
hasXSDDuration.description: Extent of a temporal entity, expressed using xsd:duration

hour.label: hour
hour.description: Hour position in a calendar-clock system.

hours.label: hours duration
hours.description: length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in hours

inDateTime.label: in date-time description
inDateTime.description: Position of an instant, expressed using a structured description

inTimePosition.label: Time position
inTimePosition.description: Position of a time instant expressed as a TimePosition

inXSDDate.label: in XSD date
inXSDDate.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:date

inXSDDateTime.label: in XSD Date-Time
inXSDDateTime.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTime

inXSDDateTimeStamp.label: in XSD Date-Time-Stamp
inXSDDateTimeStamp.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp

inXSDgYear.label: in XSD g-Year
inXSDgYear.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:gYear

inXSDgYearMonth.label: in XSD g-YearMonth
inXSDgYearMonth.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:gYearMonth

inside.label: has time instant inside
inside.description: An instant that falls inside the interval. It is not intended to include beginnings and ends of intervals.

intervalAfter.label: interval after
intervalAfter.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalAfter another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2.

intervalBefore.label: interval before
intervalBefore.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalBefore another proper interval T2, then the end of T1 is before the beginning of T2.

intervalContains.label: interval contains
intervalContains.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalContains another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.

intervalDisjoint.label: interval disjoint
intervalDisjoint.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalDisjoint another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2, or the end of T1 is before the beginning of T2, i.e. the intervals do not overlap in any way, but their ordering relationship is not known.

intervalDuring.label: interval during
intervalDuring.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalDuring another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2.

intervalEquals.label: interval equals
intervalEquals.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalEquals another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.

intervalFinishedBy.label: interval finished by
intervalFinishedBy.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalFinishedBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.

intervalFinishes.label: interval finishes
intervalFinishes.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalFinishes another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.

intervalIn.label: interval in
intervalIn.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalIn another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2 or is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2, or is coincident with the end of T2, except that end of T1 may not be coincident with the end of T2 if the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2.

intervalMeets.label: interval meets
intervalMeets.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalMeets another proper interval T2, then the end of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2.

intervalMetBy.label: interval met by
intervalMetBy.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalMetBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.

intervalOverlappedBy.label: interval overlapped by
intervalOverlappedBy.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalOverlappedBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, the beginning of T1 is before the end of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.

intervalOverlaps.label: interval overlaps
intervalOverlaps.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalOverlaps another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, the end of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2.

intervalStartedBy.label: interval started by
intervalStartedBy.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalStarted another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.

intervalStarts.label: interval starts
intervalStarts.description: If a proper interval T1 is intervalStarts another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2.

minute.label: minute
minute.description: Minute position in a calendar-clock system.

minutes.label: minutes
minutes.description: length, or element of, a temporal extent expressed in minutes

month.label: month
month.description: Month position in a calendar-clock system.The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar month from any calendar.

monthOfYear.label: month of year
monthOfYear.description: The month of the year, whose value is a member of the class time:MonthOfYear

months.label: months duration
months.description: length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in months

nominalPosition.label: Name of temporal position
nominalPosition.description: The (nominal) value indicating temporal position in an ordinal reference system

numericDuration.label: Numeric value of temporal duration
numericDuration.description: Value of a temporal extent expressed as a decimal number scaled by a temporal unit

numericPosition.label: Numeric value of temporal position
numericPosition.description: The (numeric) value indicating position within a temporal coordinate system

second.label: second
second.description: Second position in a calendar-clock system.

seconds.label: seconds duration
seconds.description: length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in seconds

timeZone.label: in time zone
timeZone.description: The time zone for clock elements in the temporal position

unitType.label: temporal unit type
unitType.description: The temporal unit which provides the precision of a date-time value or scale of a temporal extent

weeks.label: weeks duration
weeks.description: length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in weeks

xsdDateTime.label: has XSD date-time
xsdDateTime.description: Value of DateTimeInterval expressed as a compact value.

year.label: year
year.description: Year position in a calendar-clock system.The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar year from any calendar.

years.label: years duration
years.description: length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in years
